then set up a cron job to do it for you!
it is a LiveCD
whats does liveCD imply
You boot to it and it runs off the CD rather than on the harddrive... it basically just runs 'gparted' for you in a self hosting environment.
all I can say is I tried and my comp doesn't seem to think its a bootable disk
You're sure your system is set to boot from the CD first?
the md5sum checked out?
you're sure you don't just have a .iso on the CD, rather than a full CD layout?
Can you look at the CD on your other OS, does it look normal, or is there just one file (the iso) on it?
file on disk
